sentences.en: - They enjoyed extraterritoriality, and were not governed by China's laws.
sentences.cn: -- 享有不受中国法律管辖的"治外法权 ".

sentences.en: Because of the existence of extraterritoriality, the case was tried by the foreign envoys in China.
sentences.cn: 由于治外法权的存在, 该案由上海会审公廨审理,最终的结果是判处梅生九个月监禁.

sentences.en: Finally, we had extraterritoriality and used this legal advantage in order to be extremely active in the opium trade.
sentences.cn: 最后，我们有治外法权，并利用这一法律的好处，以极为活跃在鸦片贸易。

sentences.en: Japan was the first Asian country to modernize on its own terms, outside of colonial or semi-colonial control, or even, after 1895, extraterritoriality.
sentences.cn: 日本是亚洲第一个现代化的国家就其本身来说，远离殖民地或半殖民地的控制之苦，甚至，1895年以后，治外法权。

sentences.en: The issue of extraterritoriality had been a major block to Sino - American relationship.
sentences.cn: 领事裁判权问题是近代以来阻碍中美关系发展的主要症结.

sentences.en: These missionaries even wilfully extended extraterritoriality to Chinese converts and interfered in Chinese judicial authority.
sentences.cn: 这些传教士还肆意将“治外法权”延伸至中国信徒,干涉司法.

sentences.en: These missionaries even wilfully extended the extraterritoriality to Chinese converts and interfered in Chinese judicial authority.
sentences.cn: 这些传教士还肆意将"治外法权"延伸至中国信徒,干涉司法.

sentences.en: They enjoyed extraterritoriality, and were not governed by China's laws.
sentences.cn: 享有不受中国法律管辖的“治外法权”.

sentences.en: This i. e. , if in fight or being in charge of quarters period, the crime American serviceman enjoys the extraterritoriality .
sentences.cn: 这也就是说，如果是在战斗或值勤期间，犯罪的美国军人还是享有治外法权。

trans.tran_en: the privilege granted to some aliens, esp diplomats, of being exempt from the jurisdiction of the state in which they reside
